chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Harvey J L Littler II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the actions. Costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harvey J L Littler II

defendant.name: Littler, Harvey J L, II
defendant.address: 10718 Old Stage Rd, Sister Bay, WI 54234

records.addlTxt: 9:45 AM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Harvey J L Littler II in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Harvey J L Littler II.  Minute sheet. State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1.  Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 3 but reads in for sentencing.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond is no longer in effect.
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Viel requests a status/plea date in 30 days.  Bond remains in effect.

2:47 PM  Defendant Harvey J L Littler II in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Harvey J L Littler II.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Harvey J L Littler II appeared by video from the Door County Jail, Attorney Shannon Viel appeared in court for Harvey J L Littler II.  Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Atty Viel to set prelim. with JA Parks after todays hearing.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

12:56 PM Defendant Harvey J L Littler II appeared by video from the Door County Jail, Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Atty Viel requests AIA be set.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
